result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron E Simpson

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

9:32 AM Defendant Aaron E Simpson in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Aaron E Simpson.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for PH.   A written waiver of PH filed with the Court.  DE understands his rights. DE waived his PH.  Parties proceed to ARGN.   INFO to be filed mirrored CMP.    DE waived reading.  DE entered a plea of NG to all counts.   Parties have reached an agmt and intend to include this case with the other two pending cases on 11/10/22 with Judge Wickstrom.    Court requested a written agreement be filed and signed by both parties which indicates this case can be jointly plead along with other two cases.   RH set for 12/13/22 at 2:00 PM.  via Zoom.  If case is settled this RH date will be removed from calendar.   Adj. 9:39 AM
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on December 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:29 AM Defendant Aaron E Simpson appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Aaron E Simpson.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Matter set for PH.   Court informed DE of his right to appear in person.    DE wants to appear in Court in person with his attorney and requested an adjournment.   PH rescheduled to 10/28/22 at 9:30 AM.   Adj. 9:34 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:01 AM Defendant Aaron E Simpson appeared by video from RC Jail.   Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Aaron E Simpson.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Waive formal reading of the CC. DE/Atty will waive TL for PH. Court instructs on waiver of TL, DE understands waiver of TL, makes waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily, court accepts waiver of TL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

DE received a copy of the CC this morning.  Attorney Osberg informed the Court that DE has Attorney Steven Richards on prior cases.   Attorney Osberg has a message into Attorney Richards to see if he can represent DE on this case.   The other cases are set for 10/4/22 with Judge Wickstrom.   Parties informed this case currently stays with Judge Barna.     Adj. 2:54 PM

Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:22 AM - Time set for BBH.  Defendant Aaron E Simpson appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Rockow appeared by video for Aaron Simpson.  PC has been signed by TLN.  Initial appearance will be 9/7 @ 11:00 a.m.  He has two open cases with Judge Wickstrom.  State asking for $2500 sign bond with absolute sobriety.  Address:  W13490 CTY Rd O. Bruce WI.  Cell 715-403-1481, text reminders will be sent.  In person hearing on 9/7.  $2500 sign bond - No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.
